column4: Hi there! Anyone know of a good site to do Port Forwarding, learn all about it, set it up with Ubuntu, etc?
I've tried portforward.com and for whatever reason, it won't work when I follow all of my routers instructions
some routers won't activate port forwarding until you disable DHCP. annoying, I know.
unless you know how to set a static IP and have the DNS addresses, DON'T disable DHCP.
Ha ha, no. I would look it all up first. How would I learn how to setup static IPs, figure out DNSs, and all that on Ubuntu?
are you using network-manager? (the network icon in the top right corner)
right click nm-applet, click connection information. copy down IP address, default route, subnet mask, and DNS addresses.
lol, I hate it when the answers are so easy ;) Ok! Got it!
after disabling DHCP you will no longer get any addresses from your network so you'd need to enter them manually into every machine on your network
Ok! How do I make sure than my Ubuntu box is listening on the ports I need it to?
that all depends on the program you're running that needs the ports forwarded.
Yeah. I'm just trying to set it up mainly for transmission, but someone had told me that I had to be careful when selecting a port for use because specific ports are reserved for specific things.
select any port you want above 30000 as a safe rule. they can go up to 65535.
